intro: Deschampsia flexuosa proles montana, commonly known as mountain bentgrass, is a perennial grass species native to the mountainous regions of North America. It typically grows in open, moist habitats such as meadows, stream banks, and rocky slopes. This species is well adapted to cold climates and is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its resilience and ability to stabilize soil.
